column4: I am safe and can have peace of mind using Ubuntu for my netbanking etc as there is no keylogger or spyware that I need to worry about?
you're far less likely to install one unknowingly. Anybody could write a keylogger. Linux won't stop something like that existing
so how can I make sure I dont have one installed now?
there are commercial and free antivirus programs (avg, for example) just like with windows but not running/installing anything from outside the repos is a good start
so I should run AVG on Ubuntu to make sure I dnt have a keylogger installed on Hardy?
I'm not telling you that. I'm saying you *can* use an antivirus to check now but unless you're planning on downloading random untrusted source code or binaries and running those, you should be fine
I have installed 2 3rd party apps, how can I check they are ok?
btw, the same goes for Windows. Keep the system patched and updated and you'll be fine 99.999% of the time.
are you claiming that MS windows updates clean spyware and virus?
No. Not installing malware kind of goes without saying.
I believe you're being deliberately abrasive now. Unless you're here for actual support (giving or receiving), please clear off.
thou shalt not judge because your assuming to know my intentions.
